etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Manasseh Cutler (1742–1823). Partly from sun + drop

definitions: Any of various oenotheras having flowers which open in daylight; especially the yellow-flowered Oenothera fruticosa. Also in plural.

notes.text: The better-known night-flowering oenotheras are called evening primrose, which is a name also used for the genus as a whole.
